intro: Anthericum quamash, commonly known as quamash, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its tall, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. The plant thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its rhizomes are edible and have been traditionally used by Indigenous peoples for food and medicinal purposes. Anthericum quamash plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
